headline: ICE documents reveal plan to double immigrant detention space this year
description: Internal documents reveal ICE’s plans to double immigrant detention to more than 100,000 beds, including new detention centers for families.

headline: The two reasons Americans aren’t having babies, according to data
description: How costly is it to have babies in your area? Check yourself.

description: Erin is the 5th named storm of the hurricane season.

description: As heat waves batter Europe, the need (or not) for air-conditioning has become part of the political tug of war in France between the right and the left.

description: The more weather observations meteorologists can rely on, the more precise their forecasts will be. Here's what goes into an accurate forecast.

headline: Why the B.L.S. Regularly Revises Jobs Data

description: Explore our infographic showing the human toll of the atomic bombings on Japan 80 years ago.

headline: Russian Nuclear Submarine Base Was Damaged in Quake, Satellite Images Show
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: The Rybachiy base, which hosts nuclear-powered submarines from Russia’s Pacific Fleet, lies in a cove about 80 miles from the powerful earthquake that struck near the Kamchatka peninsula last week.

headline: Why are Democrats fleeing Texas to block redistricting plans, and what’s next?
description: A plan to change Texas’s congressional map could help Republicans keep control of the U.S. House in the 2026 midterms. State Democrats hope to stall it.

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: Bosch’s ‘Garden of Earthly Delights’
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: What humans can learn from some of history’s greatest zoo escapes
description: When we looked for life lessons in some of the most successful zoo escapes, we found out why we’re so fascinated by these scaly, furry, feathery fugitives.

headline: How Did Hunger Get So Much Worse in Gaza?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Less food is going into Gaza now than during most other times in the war. Hundreds of Palestinians have been killed while heading toward aid sites. Many others are suffering from serious malnutrition, and Gazan health officials say scores have died from it.

label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/

headline: Satellites and drone swarms: The new high-tech quest to fight wildfires
description: A company is sending satellites into space to detect wildfire with unprecedented precision.

headline: Here are countries that recognize a Palestinian state — or may do so soon
description: Anger over Israel’s conduct in Gaza has left it increasingly isolated as key allies move toward declarations of Palestinian statehood.

headline: ‘Welcome to hell’: Inside the mega prison where the U.S. deported migrants
description: Interviews with 16 former detainees of El Salvador’s Terrorism Confinement Center offer the most complete view yet of conditions inside the notorious prison.

headline: This Is What Basic Food Costs in Gaza Now, if You Can Find It
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: Obtaining humanitarian aid can be difficult and dangerous, and though some essentials are available at markets, they are prohibitively expensive for many Gazans.

headline: How the U.S. lost its lead in electric vehicles and other clean energy inventions
description: China dominates the global market for clean energy technology like electric vehicles, batteries and solar panels, which were all invented in the U.S.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: ICE wants to make immigration enforcement as efficient as FedEx or Amazon. Louisiana was poised for this moment.

headline: The Changing Map of Palestinian Recognition

description: In the past week alone, three new countries have said they are ready to bestow recognition on a Palestinian state.

headline: See How Texas Republicans Plan to Gain Seats in Congress

headline: Texas map would add five safe Republican seats. What it means for the midterms.
description: The newly proposed Republican map, at President Donald Trump’s urging, would give the party a potential backstop for keeping control of the House even if it performs poorly elsewhere in the 2026 elections.

headline: Gaza airdrops deliver a fraction of what trucks could, aid groups warn
description: Israel’s decision to allow Gaza airdrops to resume comes with risks and high costs, and experts say it’s not enough to meet acute need amid a starvation crisis.

headline: Earthquake off Russia’s coast is among strongest ever recorded
description: The 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula could be among the six strongest on record, according to U.S. geological authorities.

headline: 60,000 Gazans have been killed. 18,500 were children. These are their names.
description: Palestinian children have been killed at a rate of more than one per hour since the war began.

headline: Does your city have too much of one kind of tree? That can be a problem.
description: Many urban canopies across U.S. cities are dominated by only a handful of tree types, putting them at risk of being wiped out by an insect or disease.

headline: How AI is impacting 700 professions — and might impact yours
description: Will AI help you work or replace you? Check yourself.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: See which countries are being targeted by President Trump, as he seeks to remake the global trading system.

headline: Trump covets rare earth riches, but Greenland plans to mine its own business
description: Interest in Greenland’s minerals is soaring, driven in part by Trump, who has said the U.S. must “get” the island. But the rare earths will be hard to mine.

headline: Gazans are dying of hunger. Here’s what happens to a starving human body.
description: Children suffering under severe food shortages can face lifelong consequences.

headline: Mapping How Mamdani’s Ranked-Choice Strategy Beat Cuomo
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: New data provides the clearest picture yet of how Zohran Mamdani pulled off his primary election upset.

headline: After Surge During Pandemic, Homicides Fall Significantly
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: An analysis released Thursday by the Council on Criminal Justice shows that the majority of crimes the council tracks are continuing to decrease in 42 U.S. cities.

headline: The War in Gaza Leaves Toxic Legacy of Garbage, Disease and Pollution
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: The bombardment of Gaza has left contaminated soil, blackened water and mounds of garbage spreading disease and pollution; a toxic legacy that will last generations, and extend beyond its borders.

headline: This Was Supposed to Be the Year China Started Catching Up With SpaceX
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: China’s biggest networks have deployed less than 1 percent of their planned satellites, falling far behind SpaceX for dominance in space communications.

description: President Trump’s threat to impose 30% tariffs on the European Union disrupted negotiations. From cars to wine, these are the industries in the firing line.

description: Istanbul’s historic buildings, including the Hagia Sophia and Basilica Cistern, are at risk from a major earthquake on the Anatolian fault line.

headline: A new era of floods has arrived. America isn’t prepared.
description: A Washington Post investigation reveals why so few people evacuated in the state hit hardest by last year’s deadliest disaster.

description: Their actions range from pressuring the administration to release more information to spinning additional conspiracy theories about the case of Jeffrey Epstein, the convicted sex offender.

description: July’s hot temperatures and moist air are the perfect ingredients for rain.
